sentence.text: mitotic chromosome condensation functions as a tumor suppressor gene and has been reported in pancreatic tumor cells.
Here, we examined the expression level of mitotic chromosome condensation in human response to hydroperoxide tissues and renal tumor cells by real-time quantitative RT-PCR and western blot.

We found that the expression level of mitotic chromosome condensation is significantly lower in response to hydroperoxide tissues and renal tumor cells compared with adjacent non-tumorous tissues and normal renal cells.
Additionally, inhibition of mitotic chromosome condensation expression by shRNA induced tumor formation in normal renal cells.
However, inhibition of mitotic chromosome condensation did not significantly affect tumor cell proliferation in vitro and tumor progression in vivo.
Interestingly, overexpression of mitotic chromosome condensation using a eukaryotic plasmid inhibited the proliferation of renal tumor cells in vitro and the growth of renal tumor in vivo.
Thus, our results demonstrate that mitotic chromosome condensation functions as a tumor suppressor gene in renal cells and may be a useful target for treatment of RCC
